channel.title: What Program do i use to open CLASS FILES?
channel.description:
Heya all,
this is probually a stupid question but eh, what program/programs do i use to open the CLASS FILES in my Galkons Anarchy V1.5 source?

item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

The problem with these compliers is that they dont work!

I tryed to decompile client.class and the .java file was about 10 times smaller

btw with JAD do you have to change your enviroment variables?

item.source: What Program do i use to open CLASS FILES?

item.title: What Program do i use to open CLASS FILES?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

The files with .class as the extension are compiled Java classes, containing byte code. Only way to remotely edit is to decompile.
To do this, there are many programs, though in my experience +reliability + simplicity, I would suggest using a program called JAD.
More information and download links can be found here

If you’re after editing Java code, I would suggest opening the files with .java extension. They normally contain the Java source code.

Read full topic
item.source: What Program do i use to open CLASS FILES?

item.title: What Program do i use to open CLASS FILES?
item.dc:creator: @Lagex Lagex
item.description:
@Lagex wrote:

Right click, click “Open with…”, then click “Notepad”.

No problem btw, I used to be bad at this stuff.
